content.title: Carotid Restenosis
content.definition: Early restenosis (<2 years) from intimal hyperplasia, late restenosis from recurrent atherosclerosis. Treatment options include CEA or CAS.
content.statement: Carotid Restenosis is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Carotid that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding Carotid Restenosis helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Carotid Restenosis include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Carotid Restenosis.

citations.source: Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.
